result.execSummary:
The defendant William Rivera Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 5:00 pm on 09/27/2022.
Probation review hearing scheduled for 01/13/2022 at 1:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.

- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Complete Parenting Class.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Provide a DNA sample by 09/27/2022.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

- Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
- No contact with firearms or dangerous weapons (including knives).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Rivera Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Rivera Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for William Rivera Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/ Sentencing Hearing. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1 and 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 3: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Complete Parenting Class.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms or dangerous weapons (including knives).
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children. 
- Provide a DNA sample by 09/27/2022.


*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 5:00 pm on 09/27/2022.


Probation review hearing scheduled for 01/13/2022 at 1:30 pm, before Br 41.

Defendant William Rivera Jr in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for William Rivera Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Due to court calendar congestion, Court adjourns the matter for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Bail Jumping - JI

Defendant William Rivera in court with attorney JB Bastien for Ruby De Leon.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No Contact Order & Firearm Prohibition, signed and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. No new offenses that rise to the level of probable cause.
Oral No Contact Order with S.L.H.

Defendant William Rivera in court with attorney Ruby De Leon appearing as a friend of the Court.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Case in court for initial appearance.  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
